Options.Doc:
The document type to write events to. There is no default value for this setting.

Generally you should try to write only similar events to the same type.
String expansion %{foo} works here. Unless you set document_type, the event type will
be used if it exists otherwise the document type will be assigned the value of logs
Options.Name: DocumentType

Options.Doc: The number of requests that can be enqueued before flushing them. Default value is 1000
Options.Name: FlushCount

Options.Doc: The number of bytes that the bulk requests can take up before the bulk processor decides to flush. Default value is 5242880 (5MB).
Options.Name: FlushSize

Options.Doc: Host of the remote instance. Default value is "localhost"
Options.Name: Host

Options.Doc:
The amount of seconds since last flush before a flush is forced. Default value is 1

This setting helps ensure slow event rates donâ€™t get stuck.
For example, if your flush_size is 100, and you have received 10 events,
and it has been more than idle_flush_time seconds since the last flush,
those 10 events will be flushed automatically.
This helps keep both fast and slow log streams moving along in near-real-time.
Options.Name: IdleFlushTime

Options.Doc:
The index to write events to. Default value is "logstash-%Y.%m.%d"

This can be dynamic using the %{foo} syntax and strftime syntax (see http://strftime.org/).
The default value will partition your indices by day.
Options.Name: Index

Options.Doc: Password to authenticate to a secure Elasticsearch cluster. There is no default value for this setting.
Options.Name: Password

Options.Doc:
HTTP Path at which the Elasticsearch server lives. Default value is "/"

Use this if you must run Elasticsearch behind a proxy that remaps the root path for the Elasticsearch HTTP API lives.
Options.Name: Path

Options.Doc: ElasticSearch port to connect on. Default value is 9200
Options.Name: Port

Options.Doc: Username to authenticate to a secure Elasticsearch cluster. There is no default value for this setting.
Options.Name: User

Options.Doc: Enable SSL/TLS secured communication to Elasticsearch cluster. Default value is false
Options.Name: SSL
